name: paolo
review_body: I tried to open an account with DigitalOcean and, after providing all the requested information, my application was rejected with no concrete explanation. Their response only mentioned some vague â€œsecurity parametersâ€ they cannot share â€” basically shutting me out without any transparency. It is absurd that a company that claims to be developer-friendly treats potential paying customers this way. I could have been a serious, loyal, and even promoting customer for their platform, but apparently they prefer to reject people without justification. On top of that, itâ€™s not even straightforward to request the permanent deletion of personal data â€” which is unacceptable when it comes to privacy and compliance. If this is how DigitalOcean welcomes new users, I can only strongly advise others to stay away. There are far better and more respectful alternatives out there.

name: YaN CrowLeY
review_header: Hosting Illegal & Abusive Content â€“ Ignoring Victim Reports
review_body: I am a victim of a serious violation of my privacy and personal rights, and DigitalOcean is currently hosting a website that is publishing explicit photos of me without my consent. The website exposes my full name, intimate images, and personal phone number, falsely associating me with prostitution. I never authorized the publication or use of any of this content. I contacted Cloudflare first, and they confirmed that DigitalOcean is the hosting provider behind this malicious site. I then attempted to notify DigitalOcean through their abuse contact form, but received no meaningful action or response. This situation is causing me extreme emotional distress and psychological harm. DigitalOcean is enabling the distribution of non-consensual pornography and personal data, which violates international laws including: Brazilâ€™s LGPD (General Data Protection Law) Marco Civil da Internet (Brazilian Civil Rights Framework for the Internet) Brazilian Penal Code Art. 218-C (Non-consensual intimate content) International privacy and copyright laws I have already contacted lawyers and law enforcement. If DigitalOcean continues to allow this abuse through their infrastructure, I will take legal action directly against them for complicity. ðŸš¨ I strongly advise others to avoid doing business with a company that ignores victims of abuse and hosts illegal content without accountability.

name: Ron Cowart
review_header: I tried and tried to get help
review_body: I signed on with DigitalOcean a couple of months ago. However, their service would not work for my needs, so I cancelled my account. After cancelling my account, they continued to charge me. So, I reached out to them and was assured I would not be charged further. Fine, I was happy. That is, right up until I was charged again. Bear in mind, I can't even login because I deleted all of my information after they said it was taken care of. I have filed several (have lost count) appeals to support and the solution is always the same. "Destroy your bucket." Folks, I don't have a bucket to destroy and I can't login to ANYTHING. Please, just cancel me out completely! The latter, above, was sent today. I was met with "send a screenshot of what you are seeing." I have grown tired of sending them screenshots when all I am asking is to STOP CHARGING ME....PLEASE!!!! I have decided to warn others, here, about how difficult DigitalOcean is making a simple request. God help anyone who needs serious assistance.

For single-admins or smaller teams, it brings a much needed simplicity to hosting dev projects. with less faff and reading than the big 3 would have you do.

name: sam kim
review_body: I commend the quick response as well as the kindness and willingness to understand a problem and route them to relevant parties. The team also share useful resources that get you closer to solving or understanding a problem. Much appreciated :)

name: Derick
review_body: On one of the team we have in DigitalOcean, payment was NOT made and the notification emails never received. This was a complete goof up and DigitalOcean did what any respectable host would do and they shutdown/removed the managed database and the virtual machines. Once we had figured out what was going on, we reached out to support to see if there was anything they could to recover the lost database and web-server. They had absolutely no reason to tell us anything other than "Sorry, they've been deleted". Instead, they worked diligently and were able to recover the database for us which was a huge win. I am grateful to the DigitalOcean team for assisting us and they have certainly made a small fishing charter company in Florida very happy.

name: Roberto
review_header: Excellent support - billing issue resolved quickly
review_body: I had an unexpected billing issue after testing DigitalOcean with the promotional credit. My account was suspended for a $142 balance that accumulated without my awareness. However, their support team (specifically Murtaza) was very understanding and professional. They listened to my situation, waived the charges as a one-time courtesy, and helped me close the account smoothly. While I wish the trial credit usage had been more transparent, I can't fault their customer service - they resolved my issue quickly and fairly. The support was responsive and empathetic. For new users: carefully monitor your resource usage during trials to avoid similar situations. But if issues arise, their support team is helpful.

name: Giles Rafol
review_header: Great Service for my Small Projects!
review_body: I've been using Digital Ocean for at least 2yrs to host a small voice server my group of friends. Spinning up a Droplet is quick and easy. It takes just a few clicks to get things up and running. As such, I've also spun up Droplets here and here and there for testing and educational purposes. Then when I'm done with one, it's just as easy to delete. And same with maintaining them. The service is very stable; I don't think I've dealt with any outages any Digital Ocean so far. They make it easy to set up backups and perform snapshots and rollback when desired. Importantly the service is very inexpensive for our needs. For a pretty basic Droplet with weekly backups, I'm paying like $7-8/mo. One of the things I like is that I'm essentially paying by the hour. So if I spin up another Droplet to test something that only takes me an hour to do, I can delete it afterwards, and I'm only billed for that hour (which only costs a few cents). I'm not committed to a monthly fee. It's strictly pay as you go. Lastly, their support is excellent. I was doing some maintenance on the server recently, which caused a relatively minor issue with some of the metrics collection that Digital Ocean provides. Their support team was super quick to respond over the weekend. All my interactions with their team members were polite, friendly, and helpful! They really want their customers to succeed in their projects and I think that's commendable. For small projects and needs like mine, I highly recommend Digital Ocean!

review_header: Great support when I needed it

review_header: DigitalOcean makes sure you know what you're paying for.
review_body: DigitalOcean makes sure you know what youre paying for, and how much you're paying for, while they might have some trust issues (understandably, due to crypto miners etc ruining stuff for others), they're still a good platform, the UI is modern and navigateable, however it could use a bit less clutter.

name: Pratch Hemapanpairo
review_body: I was prepared to wait up to 24 hours (as stated on DigitalOcean's own website) for a generic automated response to my issue (something regarding their security measures). However, after the first automated followup query, I got in touch with a staff member who was able to consider and take care of my case. I hope they keep this aspect of their service as they grow.

name: Eric Arwido Damanik
review_header: Frustrating and UncFrustrating and Unclear Rejection for a New Student Developer.lear Rejection for aâ€¦
review_body: As a student developer excited to use the GitHub Student Developer Pack, I chose DigitalOcean to host my first full-stack portfolio project. The initial sign-up process was smooth. However, my account was immediately flagged for "Additional Info Required." I understand the need for security, so I promptly created a support ticket and provided a detailed, honest explanation of my educational project goals and the specific technical resources I planned to use, as requested. The most disappointing part of my experience was the response. After waiting, I received a generic email stating that my account activation was rejected, with no specific reason provided. For a student genuinely trying to learn and use the platform for a legitimate portfolio project, this rejection felt like hitting a wall. While I understand the need to prevent abuse, the lack of transparency or guidance for legitimate new users is a major barrier. It would be much more helpful to provide feedback on what was wrong or how to meet the platform's criteria, rather than a final rejection that discourages new developers from considering DigitalOcean in the future. The process felt impersonal and did not seem to consider the context of a student user.

name: SHAHROKH DELGOSHAD

review_body: I've been using DigitalOcean for hosting and object storage (Spaces) and Iâ€™m very satisfied so far. The platform is intuitive, reliable, and gives you the control developers need without unnecessary complexity. One of the highlights has been their support â€” I reached out with a question and got a quick, helpful response. Itâ€™s clear they value their users and know their product well. Great documentation, transparent pricing, and solid performance. Highly recommended for developers and small teams looking for scalable infrastructure.

name: Palitha Lahiru
review_header: Extremely Disappointed â€“ Poor Communication and Unfair Charges
review_body: I used a VPS from DigitalOcean for a few months. Recently, they sent a copyright-related notice to my email â€” unfortunately, it went to my spam folder, so I missed it. Without any further warning or follow-up, they blocked the public IP address of my server. This caused a major outage for one of my clients, and I only found out when their system stopped working completely. I immediately contacted DigitalOcean support to resolve the issue, but after waiting more than 16 hours, I still didnâ€™t receive a response. With no communication from their end, I had to pause all my work and migrate the entire platform to AWS at my own cost. I also had to compensate my client for the downtime. To make things worse, even though the server was inaccessible, DigitalOcean continued charging me for it daily. After 4 days with no response from support, I deleted the host entirely. Their handling of the situation was unprofessional, slow, and costly. I cannot recommend DigitalOcean after this experience. If your work is time-sensitive or client-critical, look elsewhere. Fast, reliable support and transparent communication are essential â€” and sadly, DigitalOcean fell short on both.

name: Dave
review_body: The absolute worst customer service. They do not have additional billing contacts to prevent a lack of communication on their end from resulting in *all of your resources destroyed*. I was paying for backups for years -- then they shut down a mail server and didn't bother to attempt any other contact besides bouncing e-mails. They *permanently and irrevocably deleted* all of my virtual machines after a few weeks of failing to contact me. You would think they would spend the extra few pennies to allow a customer to keep paying them. Nope, they do not care about you or your business. Do not make the mistake of hosting business-critical services with Digital Ocean. AVOID. Case in point -- See DigitalOcean's response. Note they do not offer a way to provide that case number to their support staff. It does not matter, I tried at least 4 times to resolve the issue with their support staff. They were not at all willing to resolve the issue and refused to respond with anything other than what seemed like AI generated garbage. After my experience I cancelled my service and I am not interested in resuming it.

review_body: An ongoing problem with tech is the tendency to complicate and load all interactions with jargon. Try finding any documentation or help screen that actually makes sense. I have been in the industry for forty-five years and I still struggle with this. My last problem was answered with a simple and understandable response: "Your server is out of date. You must upgrade to a new server". That's it, that was all I needed to know. I may have lost several days of my life *doing* the migration ... but that is the nature of what I do. A clear and meaningful explanation of the issue and the way forward was a brilliant help. I wish someone could explain how nginx and other tools operate with such clarity.

name: Alexei Danilchik
review_header: Theyâ€™re really good, but be prepared for their changes to catch you off guard
review_body: Iâ€™ve been with DigitalOcean for about 10 years. During that time, Iâ€™ve had almost zero issues with them. Their documentation is extensive, everything is well-structured and user-friendly, and the service has been rock-solid. Iâ€™ve never had to contact support because my own knowledge was enough to handle any problems. Over the years, Iâ€™ve referred many clients to them, including some with substantial budgets. However, the recent changes - when they abruptly start blocking SMTP port 587 for new and upsizing droplets without warning left me deeply frustrated. I had to scramble to rebuild transactional email systems for clients. Relying on third-party email services isnâ€™t always a viable solution. This is unacceptable behavior, such changes cannot be implemented "overnight", without prior notice. On the other hand, they're willing to remove restrictions upon request to customer support, but this takes a lot of time unless you have a paid support subscription.

After going back and forth with simple diagnostics and solutions which didn't fix the issue, I have been given a courtesy credits of the amount that was supposed to be applied. No other issues with hosting.

review_body: I never wrote a review, yet their extremely fast & helpful support (although Iâ€™m on the Free Support plan) resolved my specific country-related issue and gave me credits to use on their platform while my issue wasnâ€™t their fault yet it was solved. Itâ€™s rare to get that type of support on platforms offering high-end cloud services unless you pay for support plans or if you are a high paying customer. Along with top-notch reliable services, they are focusing on GenAI to enable you innovate using their recent releases like (GPU Droplets, GenAI platform) where new models & features are added frequently. review_header: Excellent Customer Support and Understanding Team
review_body: I recently had an issue with my account suspension due to billing delays, and I reached out to DigitalOcean Support. I was pleasantly surprised by how understanding and professional the support team was(especially Durrab), who handled my ticket. They took the time to review my case, approved the payment plan I proposed, and reinstated access to all my resources without delay. I appreciated their clear communication and willingness to help rather than penalize. They even set a new suspension date and promised to monitor progress without being overbearing. Itâ€™s rare to come across such responsive and empathetic support. I felt heard, supported, and respected throughout the entire process. Truly a five-star experience! Highly recommended for anyone who values reliable service and human-centered support!

name: California customer
review_body: Our DigitalOcean account was unexpectedly closed without any prior notice. When we attempted to resolve the issue, we were informed that the account had been flagged by their automated security system â€”apparently due to our lack of our social media presence. We were unaware that DigitalOceanâ€™s terms and conditions permit account termination without notice and disclaim responsibility for any resulting data loss or destruction. We were also unaware that social media presence was a condition of establishing and maintaining the service. Unfortunately, due to this clause, we are now in the process of moving our services to another provider. However, we felt it was important to share our deeply disappointing experience. Customer service was minimal and unhelpful responses were infrequent, poorly written, and clearly handled by offshore agents. There is no phone support available, and live chat is only offered at a $99/month fee.

name: Matthew Burdett
review_header: I have used Digitalocean for a whileâ€¦
review_body: I have used Digitalocean for a while but have found myself moving elsewhere due to the droplet range providing poor value for money. Digitalocean's support and community is unrivalled and offers a fantastic level of support and documentation to help novice users get up and running quickly with detailed explanations. My choice to move my resources away is due to the pricing of Digitalocean's VPS range. I am paying $8 for a 1gb ram 1cpu droplet, attempting to run a Wordpress Openlitespeed installation, and the site runs miserably. Repeated, daily "Error establishing a database connection". Understandably, the answer lies in upgrading to a server with more resources, but why should I pay $20+ when I can pay half the price elsewhere? To put into perspective, Digitalocean cost me $8 for 1CPU 1GB RAM OVH cost me $5 for 2CPU 2GB RAM On a legacy range I have a VPS with 16GB RAM costing just Â£20, the same with Digitalocean would cost me a heck lot more! At the end of the day I need a vps solution that balances my expense and turnover properly and digitalocean unfortunately doesnt allow for that. By paying less and getting more elsewhere the site runs fine. Instead I use digitalocean's budget range of products labelled general purpose, for my less intensive tasks like FTP and front end applications

name: Dasun Sameera Weerasinghe
review_header: As a loyal customer of 10 years
review_body: As a loyal customer of 10 years, I recently experienced an incident that truly demonstrated this company's exceptional customer service. One of my droplets, hosting an old static website that was still serving its purpose but admittedly hadn't received much attention, was unfortunately compromised by malicious actors. These unauthorized users exploited the situation and consumed an excessive amount of bandwidth, resulting in an unexpected bill of several thousand dollars. When I reached out to the support team to explain the situation, I was immediately impressed by their response. They listened attentively to my circumstances and showed genuine understanding of the oversight that led to this security breach. What stood out most was their willingness to work with me on a solution - they generously provided a substantial refund of the charges. This experience highlighted not only their commitment to customer satisfaction but also their reasonable and fair approach to resolving issues, even when the root cause was partially due to my own oversight. Their handling of the situation has only strengthened my trust in their service after a decade of being their customer.

review_body: They took my money but denied a service. I tried to open an account with them, it asked me my credit card so I entered it. Not a single word about my money paid for nothing. Hello there, Thank you for reaching out to DigitalOcean about activating your account. After an extensive manual review, we are unable to move forward with activating your account on our platform at this time. We understand this may not be the expected outcome. However, we have examined the details provided and are unable to accommodate your request. We welcome any additional information you can provide to better help us understand your business case on DigitalOcean. There are some parameters used in the activation reviews that we cannot share for the safety of DigitalOcean. As your business case and associated details improve, we encourage you to consider DigitalOcean in the future as your provider. Warmest regards, Trevor Customer Experience Manager DigitalOcean Support

review_body: I recently encountered an issue with a domain on my DigitalOcean account, and I must say, their technical support team was absolutely outstanding! name: Edvinas Liuima
review_body: I trusted DigitalOcean to host critical workflows, but they suspended my account without warning, shutting down all my servers and crippling my business overnight. No prior notice, no chance to resolveâ€”just an automated system locking me out. To make things worse, their support is extremely slow, demanding unnecessary ID verification and taking days to "review" while my operations remain stuck. Even after complying, they refuse to restore access or at least allow data transfer. This level of incompetence and lack of care for customers is unacceptable. If you need reliable hosting, stay away from DigitalOcean. They have proven to be untrustworthy and irresponsible with their users businesses. 1 star is too much.

review_body: DigitalOcean has been instrumental in my growth, both as a junior developer and now as the owner of my own tech business. Their simple pricing, intuitive interface, and robust infrastructure have saved me countless hours and headaches. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable and efficient cloud hosting provider.

name: Tim Browning
review_header: No frills hosting with amazing support. Great prices.
review_body: I chose DO for my hosting over 10 years ago after advice from a trusted friend. As no-frills hosting, my three droplets are perfect for my needs and well priced. On the two occasions over those 10 years that I have needed support, my tickets were answered within 10 minutes despite being on a standard 24hr support tier. Both times the advice was friendly and 100% spot-on; Even as a relative novice to Linux, I was able to fix the issues using the well-written guidelines provided and my sites were live again within 30 minutes. Two issues in ten years, both fixed within half an hour. Can't ask for more than that!

name: Marios Fotiou
review_body: Helpfull explanatory ,dive into the issue

name: Matthew
review_header: Charged $5 a month without my knowledge
review_body: I used Digital Oceans Droplet service for a few months to run a piece of code in the cloud, eventually I cancelled the droplet because I didn't need it running 24/7 anymore. I recently found out that since then I have been unknowingly getting billed $5 a month for the IP address that the droplet once existed on. Nowhere on the dashboard did it make it whatsoever clear that I would get billed for the IP address and the "Estimated account charge per month" displayed 0. I never received an invoice from Digital Ocean until I eventually noticed the charges and logged in to look, the invoice I was able to view in my cloud dashboard did not list out what I was being charged for, it just listed "Usage Charges - %5.00". I then from that point spent about an hour trying to find where the service that I was getting charged for was as they do not have any spot on their website (that I could find) where it lists out all active services, only different pages for different types of services under different teams. I am extremely disappointed in the transparency from Digital Ocean on how I will be charged at the end of the month and what I have been getting charged for

name: ismail
review_header: Frustrating Experience with Address Update and Lack of Resolution
review_body: I have been a loyal DigitalOcean customer for over 5 years, but my recent experience has been extremely frustrating. I needed to update my billing address to Brazil, and I took the following steps: Updated the address to Brazil in my account settings. Deleted my credit card and re-added it with the correct Brazil address. Logged in via Brazil using a VPN. Despite these efforts, the system still does not reflect the correct address. I reached out for help, but no manual resolution was provided. I even requested a 20% permanent discount as compensation for the inconvenience, yet this issue remains unresolved. If this problem cannot be fixed, I will have no choice but to close my account, even though I have been a paying customer for years. This experience is disappointing and does not align with the level of service I expect from a company like DigitalOcean.

review_body: I have been using DO services for years. Alongside whenever I was looking for general instructions about server administration, somehow their atticles were the first to appear in google search results and were usually the best explanations I found on the internet. I have always been satisfied with their service in technical terms as well as with pricing. Recently I had a tough problem where my gmail login failed due to an issue with Google. I can imagine it is hard to create a fair and bulletproof recovery process for situations like mine. It did take a few days, but the issue was resolved in the utmost proffesional way. I had been given straight to the point precise instructions and every step made absolute sense. My problem was resolved with unexpected ease and it saved me an enourmous amount of time had I lost that account. I am happy to finally be able to use DO services for the new business I have just started. I hope DO will remain a reliable company as it did so far, especially in these times when it is tough to find responsible and reliable employees.

review_body: DigitalOcean is great when the Marketplace containers actually WORK. Unfortunately, its greatest feature is also its worst feature. There's a ton of abandoned projects in the Marketplace that will still happily take your money and give you no service in return... not even the license features that you just paid for. DigitalOcean obviously does not have any oversight or regulation of the products that they offer from the Marketplace. I am pretty pissed right now because I've tried multiple web admin panels in Marketplace, and gotten ripped off on every single one. Even Plesk, which is still active. Bought a license through Marketplace and never got an actual license key.

review_header: Signed up for new account specificallyâ€¦
review_body: Signed up for new account specifically to migrate my on prem whisperx workflow to Cloud. Whisper X needs GPU to run at a decent speed, I've reached capacity on premise. Tried to create gpu droplet... not allowed. Quota of 0. Asked for an increase to 1. Declined due to lack of billing history. I created the account because I needed the GPU Droplet, there will be no billing history if I can't create it. Catch 22. I'm not going to run up a bill for services I don't need. They could even have asked for a pre-payment or whatever if they felt new customers are a risk. They didn't. Complete waste of time. They just turned away a new customer. In time I might have added to these services (Currently use on prem and Google Cloud and Oracle Cloud) but these clowns fell at the first hurdle. I will be sure not to use them in future. And tell my friends.

review_body: DigitalOcean has been fantastic for my hosting needs. The platform is incredibly easy to use, even for someone with basic technical skills. I also love their flexible pricing, which allows me to control my costs. Overall, DigitalOcean offers excellent performance, great support, and unbeatable value. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for a reliable cloud provider!

review_header: More effort chasing 10Â¢ than helping with support
review_body: Digital Ocean has spent more time and effort chasing me for 10Â¢ (literally) than helping with the questions I've had about projects and infrastructure. When I needed technical guidance on a project, the reply from my "account manager" was basically "you can order services here..". A warning to anyone else: if you cancel your services with them, add-ons for those services are not cancelled. The technical services are great but completely let down by the complete lack of help and support. Update (following their understanding reply here): DO are now threatening to refer my 10Â¢ debt to a debt collection agency. @DigitalOcean: I didn't have a ticket number. My account manager emailed asking what I needed help with. That was the sum of his reply. It makes no difference now as I've moved to another provider.

review_header: Reliable, Cheap, User Friendly, Awesome Customer Service

The Customer Service is the best I experienced when you have an issue, you feel real person answers and not just Template, and their response time is too fast for me, cause I often respond back late at my own ticket.

review_body: I used Digital Ocean in the past and wanted to try again for a new business I was launching. Couldn't get past the account creation stage. Pretty ballsy for a company that doesn't offer 24/7 phone and ticket and live chat support like Linode. Linode sign-up went smooth as butter. They will get my money and services. Linode actually offers the same products at comparable prices, but actually offers 24/7 support across live chat and phone and ticket. You can't contact Digital Ocean except through ticket response. Absolutely trash service by Digital Ocean.

I mean WHO THE F does that? I was using your service for 1 year, then a third party person does something, where I am a victim, and you not just block me, but don't even give me my data? My blogs of one year are lost, all the SEO i did, all the work I put in. Its just messed up.

review_header: By far the worst hosting provider byâ€¦
review_body: By far the worst hosting provider by far. I have had nothing but issues with this company. Their hosting promises good quality and a reliable service. This is NOT true. Slow load time. Database issues and failure to address issues raised. Phone calls by the sales manager and tech manager were ignored. Their customer support is shocking. Always blames the structure of the site. We then get this adjusted and the speed and bugs are still present. Then somehow it's all fixed. Magically you say has nothing been done. Then a week later its back so rubbish. It's like you have a button in the back you press to make it work. You have cost me thousands in lost orders, downtime and simply hosting the site but providing a substandard service. I have asked for compensation this has been ignored. I hope you as a company crash and burn !!! Really do hate you. Since this, I have moved to another provider with half the cost and my god the speed is amazing, and low and behold all the bugs are magically gone. DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU WISH YOUR BUSINESS TO LOSE THOUSANDS. YOU WILL REGRET USING DIGITAL OCEAN

name: Victor van Maasvlakte
review_header: DigitalOcean are a bunch of cucks
review_body: DigitalOcean are a bunch of cucks! I was a customer for over 7 years with multiple big servers running, spending thousands a month. One of my webapps randomly got DMCA'ed by a competitor (it was a false DMCA claim). Without taking even a minute to manually check the claim, they shut down my droplet â€” thousands of dollars of revenue lost. Beware! If you have a small server, DigitalOcean is fine. But don't you ever try and rely on DigitalOcean if you are a large business, because your competition can just take down your server without any issues. I've tried emailing, messaging on Twitter, and they just. won't. take a bloody second to look into it. Moved all my servers to Hetzner for some good old German stability. Ciao ciao DigitalOcean, see you never!

name: madze
review_body: Digital ocean has, in my opinion the best balance of services, ease of use, and pricing strategy of any PAAS that we've explored. Their documentation is also second to none, and in the rare case that an issue arises that isn't well documented, their support team is excellent and responsive. I think the only service that we've used that could potentially benefit from some improvement is App Platform. In general, this is a very nice alternative to other big players (netlify, vercel) - particularly the pricing model. That said, this is definitely the service that we have had the most issues come up, and confusion with configurations and the console UI. It's also relatively new and will likely continue to be improved so I'm inclined to refrain from forming any concrete judgement just yet.

name: Christian Contardi
review_header: Exceptional Cloud Hosting with Outstanding Support
review_body: I've been using DigitalOcean for over six months now, and I can confidently say itâ€™s one of the best cloud hosting providers out there. The platform is incredibly reliable, with virtually no downtime, and the performance of their servers is top-notch. One of the standout features of DigitalOcean is its simplicity and ease of use. The control panel is intuitive, making it easy to manage your servers and deploy applications quickly. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced developer, you'll find the interface user-friendly and efficient. The range of services offered is also impressive, from droplets to managed databases, and Kubernetes, there's a solution for every need. The documentation is thorough and clear, helping me resolve issues and learn new techniques without needing to seek external help. What truly sets DigitalOcean apart is their customer support. Anytime Iâ€™ve had an issue, their support team has been prompt, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful. It's clear they prioritize customer satisfaction, and it shows in their service quality. Overall, DigitalOcean provides excellent value for money, combining high performance, reliability, and outstanding support. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a dependable cloud hosting solution.

name: èƒ¡jm
review_body: In today's rapidly evolving digital age, servers play a crucial role, serving as the cornerstone of network services and data management. A quality experience with servers is reflected not only in their performance and stability but also in the speed and effectiveness of customer service and technical support. In this article, I will share a memorable server experience, which is not just an appreciation for the hardware, but also a gratitude towards the service providers. ### Stability and High Performance of the Server In the project I was responsible for, we needed a server. We chose Digital Ocean, a well-known server provider. What was truly impressive is the server's high stability and reliability since deployment. It could continuously handle data requests, even during peak times, without significant drops in response speed. This provided a stable operating environment for our project, ensuring consistency and reliability in user experience. ### Immediate, Professional Customer Service Although the server's performance was satisfying, technical issues were inevitable during use. This was when the importance of the server provider's customer service and technical support became evident. When encountering a configuration issue, we contacted their customer service. Surprisingly, not only did they respond quickly, but they also provided very professional guidance. Their technical team carefully analyzed our situation, offered targeted solutions, and guided us through solving the problem step by step. This efficient and professional service experience was very satisfying and reassuring. ### Service That Exceeds Expectations Beyond solving problems, the server provider also proactively offered optimization suggestions, helping us improve server usage efficiency and performance. This proactive approach and attitude that exceeded customer expectations were impressive. It not only solved the immediate issue but also prevented potential future problems, making this forward-thinking service invaluable. ### Conclusion A quality server experience is both a trust in technology and a recognition of service quality. It's not only about hardware performance but more about the professionalism and care of the service team. A reliable server, coupled with professional and timely technical support, can significantly enhance work efficiency and ensure the smooth progress of projects. Such an experience deeply made me realize the value of technology service providers, laying a solid foundation for the success of our project.

They required â€œevidenceâ€ of the hacking, however, they failed to include any way of getting them the evidence. No attachment option and no email option that I could find on their site. name: Anthony
review_header: I am writing to express myâ€¦
review_body: I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the billing practices of Paperspace. Recently, I was unexpectedly charged Â£15.72 for building the spec PC and by DigitalOcean today i find out i was owe money today for 30 seconds of service than giving me a warning is gives me a loan for $19.73, which I believe to be a scam. At no point was I informed about any potential additional costs or payment obligations in the initial agreement as we never read them and only look at the page i never warned about them having a hidden cost that hidden where i can't tell if is only for running cost and not for mouthy cost . Here are the key issues I encountered: provided with no info about hidden costs by Paperspace did not indicate that I would owe any money beyond the initial setup fees. This lack of clarity led to unforeseen charges that were not disclosed upfront. Billing Practices: I was charged $19.73 for a mere 30 seconds of usage, This charge was not clearly explained or justified in any communication or payments so i was owe money for nothing until i look at . Misleading Information: It appears that Paperspace may be using infrastructure that is not entirely theirs. This was shown by disclosed at any point, and I feel deceived as a customer. Additionally, I found that DigitalOcean claims I owe them money through Paperspace, which is troubling. There was no prior communication or any email indicating that I would be liable for additional costs from DigitalOcean. This lack of transparency has caused significant inconvenience and financial stress. In comparison, Shadow PC offers similar services without such hidden charges. They have never restricted my access to their systems, unlike Paperspace, which I suspect may be due to them recognising my advanced usage needs. Conclusion Paperspace's billing practices and lack of transparency have led to a highly unsatisfactory experience. I urge inspectors to review these practices to protect future customers from similar issues. Clear, upfront communication about all potential charges and liabilities is essential to maintain trust and integrity in such services. DigitalOcean - Has never tell to place a info where they need to says about the costs of building them ( Only shown hourly payments not mouthly when i review my payment they never says about owe money I hope they refund the money they Owe because when did anyone review the documentation ever now in 2024 we used everything from 1998 to build them not clear and even says about hidden costs on the site where you rent them ( I know them a scam now ) Saying this now Your account has been restricted and you cannot create new resources. Please submit a payment of $50.00 before Wednesday, Jun 12 to prevent account suspension. prevent account suspension - for nothing never said about this so it RIGGED TO FAIL everyone who willing to pay

name: FilippNorz
review_body: Hello DigitalOcean Team, Thank you so much for your message and your commitment to providing outstanding customer service and support to all your valued customers, like myself. I have always enjoyed the quality and exceptional support you provide, and I am very pleased with the prompt and effective resolution you provided this time as well. I understand how positive user feedback like mine can help others make more confident choices about DigitalOceanâ€™s services. DigitalOcean is a cloud platform designed for developers, startups and individual users1. This cloud platform offers simple tools to help you manage your apps and websites. Some of DigitalOcean's services include: Droplets (virtual machines): Droplets are scalable virtual machines for hosting and VPS. With Droplets, you can host your own websites and applications. Kubernetes: Kubernetes managed by DigitalOcean is a scalable solution that includes a 99.5% SLA and free control platform. Database management: DigitalOcean provides the possibility to manage MongoDB, Kafka, MySQL, PostgreSQL and Redis databases. You can focus on your applications and DigitalOcean takes care of updating and scaling your databases. Storage: DigitalOcean offers Spaces object storage and Volumes block storage. App Platform: App Platform is a fully managed PaaS that lets you bring your apps to market quickly. Dedicated support: You can use free, personalized support or upgrade to paid plans for faster help and response times. Simplicity and Predictable Pricing: DigitalOcean products come with simplicity in design and predictable pricing. I am happy to take a minute to share my experiences on Trustpilot and help spread the love for DO. Thank you again for everything, and I look forward to more collaborations with you. Best regards Filipp Norz

review_body: I recently faced a rather complex issue involving domain configuration and SSL setup for my website hosted on DigitalOcean. Navigating such technicalities can often be daunting, but the support team at DigitalOcean made it a breeze. From the get-go, their support engineers were on the ballâ€”providing clear, concise instructions and staying with me every step of the way until everything was up and running. Their patience and expertise shone through, especially when they helped me resolve an SSL protocol error that had me stumped. Iâ€™m also in the process of integrating my backend with the app platform, and Iâ€™ve every confidence that should I hit a snag, the DigitalOcean support team will be there to assist. It's not just the platform that's robust and user-friendlyâ€”their customer service is top-notch too. I couldn't be more satisfied with my experience. DigitalOcean has solidified my trust in their service, and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable cloud infrastructure provider. â€” Serhat Soruklu

name: Alexander
review_header: Business's account suspended, support give a generic response. Moved to a competitor, much better!
review_body: UPDATE: They replied to this review asking for a ticket id saying they would review it again. 4 months on from that and still nothing! Clearly a empty promise to try and save face on bad reviews. I have been a personal customer of Digital Ocean for years and never had a problem. I recently wanted to create an account for my business. Went on to create the account, added the business's credit card, used the business's email, etc. The account was automatically suspended and said that I needed to supply additional details; this isn't too uncommon so didn't think much of it. The issue is that to "maintain the integrity of our security systems" the support can't tell you what information they want. It is so random. I told them what we planned to use it for, a sales tracking tool and supplied our GitHub. I also included a copy of my ID, lots of business documents (bank statements & insurance) and even invoices from their sister company Cloudways, were we have had an active account at (with the same email) for over two year. This was all rejected and given a generic, "we cannot disclose which factors were identified" for why we can't accept this. I am not sure what else they could want. We are a UK based company with a large amount spent at their sister company, I had given document to verify the business and myself. I understand the need for security but I sent enough info to get a bank account and pass any KYC/AML checks, as well as told them what we were going to use it for. What else do they want? If they are so boneheaded to have rules like this then how will they react if something goes wrong with their service? I closed our account with Cloudways and have moved everything to OVH where instead of getting suspended and getting absolutely zero help from support on how to unsuspend it, you get assigned an account manager who rings you to make sure you aren't having any problems onboarding. I know what I prefer. Ticket #08670478

name: NicolÃ¡s Alvarez
review_body: I had a problem with my server giving high network packet loss. I sent a support ticket, they asked me for more information and logs, and then they could fix the problem on their end. I had no downtime while they applied the fix. Replies from them were each less than 4 hours after my initial ticket and replies, even though I don't have a paid support plan with guaranteed response times. The only minor detail I could complain about is that part of the extra information they asked me for was something I had already said in my initial ticket. However, I'm sure that's because support reps use reply templates to save time, and I must say despite those templates, the whole interaction still "felt personal", and not like I was getting canned responses all the time.

review_header: D.O. support is as amazing as their prices!
review_body: I asked a question that I thought was much to broad for "general" support that dealt entirely with the O/S setup. It was entirely about CSF and iptables, not droplet related at all. Their responses were insightful and timely. They asked me to clarify a few things. Then they told me exactly what I asked for, in detail. They also suggested a novice Linux administrator might find the Web Based GUI network firewall offering that runs outside the droplet a better approach. Not only is it perfect for my needs, it is FREE!

name: RandomGuy
review_body: STAY AWAY. I had only good things to say about DO until... I deployed a small droplet to host an app integrating 2 systems. Very basic straightforward use case of pulling data from one system and sending it to another. No emailing functionality, no scraping, no suspicious business whatsover. It's literally automating copy-pasting manual work. Barely a month in and out of the blue, I receive an account suspension email. The droplet was inaccessible and the app was down. Surely an error! Back and forth of them asking for detailed personal information without providing any specific reason beyond "platform abuse involving your account and/or DigitalOcean resources". No amount of information and offers to rectify any mishap made a difference... No access to the droplet so I cannot investigate and they don't say what they spotted or what went wrong. Once it became clear that the suspension wasn't going away, I asked for the data on the droplet.. Low and behold: "Unfortunately, we can not proceed further with your request to unlock the account temporarily to retrieve the data." In conclusion: run and don't look back. They will remove your access, not give any reason and withhold your data!

name: A guy from Austria
review_body: Let me tell you about my experience, it's bad on multiple levels. 1. I registered for DigitalOcean and my account was locked immediately for no reason. So I opened a support ticket. 2. This ticket was opened in August 2023, at the time of this review it's February 2024. I contacted the support again a few days ago, and they answered within an hour. My account was unlocked again. 3. So finally, I could use DigitalOcean. Could I? No, because their interface doesn't accept my tax number. My tax number starts with letters, but their input field does not accept letters at all. So I tried putting in my personal tax number, which does not, but it also didn't work. It also didn't accept my tax number without the letters. 4. So I contacted their support again with the hope that I would get a similarly fast response, but I'm still waiting. 5. Just to complete the list: They list me services for which I need to apply. Basically, I cannot create those resources unless I contact their support and they unlock those for me. 6. Update: After having written this review. The support kept telling me how to fill out the tax field, and I kept repeating that I couldn't. Eventually, I explained to them that I either kept doing something wrong or their system did not work, and if they kept telling me how to do it, it was likely that I would not find my mistake. Now they said that they will "come back" to me. It sums up how many things do not work at DigitalOcean. Summarized, in the meantime, I created an AWS account. The integration was super easy, and they did not ask any stupid questions. Since I started building a part of my application on AWS, I do not think that I will consider DigitalOcean again. Mixing cloud providers is not a good idea. If someone from DigitalOcean is reading this: You could have had me as your customer, but you did not want me.

review_body: Customer service was excellent and answered my questions quickly.

EDIT: I have spoken to support and they have told me that they wait 5 WEEKS before removing everyones data irreversibly in case they miss an invoice. This is absolutely RIDICULOUS! Again, go to AWS, DIgitalOcean is a JOKE.

name: Nik M
review_header: Frustrating Experience with Server Issues and Support at DigitalOcean
review_body: I recently had a challenging experience with DigitalOcean, particularly with server-related issues that were not due to any fault on my end. The primary problem was with my CRON jobs, which unexpectedly stopped executing. This issue required me to monitor and identify the problem myself before reaching out to their support team for assistance. Upon contacting DigitalOcean for help, I was disappointed with their response. Instead of offering a direct solution or acknowledging the inconvenience caused, they provided me with a set of steps to upgrade the server. As someone who relies on their service, I found it frustrating to be tasked with technical troubleshooting, which I believe should have been managed on their end. Moreover, I had requested a refund for the period when the droplet was non-functional due to these server issues. Unfortunately, my request was overlooked, adding to my dissatisfaction. The support team, although courteous, did not address this concern adequately. In the end, I made the decision to cancel my droplet and move to a different provider. While I understand that technical issues can happen, I believe the way they are handled makes a significant difference in customer experience. Unfortunately, in my case, DigitalOcean's approach and support did not meet my expectations. Ticket ref: ref:!00Df2018t5m.!5004P02KM5pD:ref

They are really focusing one SOLVING your issues instead of sending you a plain description article. From providing FAQ if we don't find the right article to fixing small technical issues, we get our issues solved within the same day and even on holidays. Also, the fact that we can increase our droplets in speed, size, power within seconds, makes us highly scalable and is critical to our infrastructure. This is the partner we like building our small business with.

name: Dave
review_body: The product is good, but everything else is concerning. You can get your account completely locked in the middle of setting up projects for clients after having used DigitalOcean for months. Support can ignore your ticket for two weeks, and when you attempt to create a new ticket for the same issue it will automatically be closed. I was only able to get support to take a look at my ticket by creating a ticket in a completely unrelated section with the text completely reworded. They will refuse to explain why your account got locked and will offer zero reassurance that it won't happen again and no advice for how it can be avoided. Great for hobby projects or if you don't mind potential downtime or loss of data. If you're a professional, I would avoid it.

review_header: DigitalOcean: The Perfect Host for TaxiMpv4u.com â€“ A Year of Seamless Excellence!
review_body: When I signed up, DigitalOcean impressed me with its user-friendly interface. Navigating through the dashboard is a breeze, and setting up droplets, databases, and other resources is incredibly intuitive. This simplicity and powerful functionality make managing my projects a joy. Customer support at DigitalOcean deserves a special mention. Whenever I've had a question or encountered an issue, the support team has responded quickly, knowledgeably, and helpfully. Their dedication to customer satisfaction has undoubtedly contributed to my loyalty over the past year. In conclusion, DigitalOcean has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. As I celebrate my first anniversary with this outstanding platform, I look forward to many more years of collaboration. If you're looking for a reliable, user-friendly, and high-performance cloud hosting provider, DigitalOcean is the clear choice. Here's to a year of excellence and many more to come!

review_body: I've been customer for several years, now have 6 teams and use various services. Mostly I am happy - simple products at good prices. Two areas which annoy me are: - Container Registry free level is tiny. What is worse is that, if limit is breached, push fails and allowance is filled with garbage that only Digital Ocean support can remove. Just terrible value compared to AWS et al. - Managed Database Service minimum price is $15 per month for 10GB, when most of my applications need only 100MB. This is driving me to other cloud service providers.

name: Robert Stone
review_header: Good service even for the "little guy"
review_body: I'm one of those guys who usually just has one VPS running, but running all the time. Well mine was running for 7 years, even when I wasn't paying much attention to it. Never had any problems, never had it get deleted or had to reinstall it due to an upgrade or anything. And the one time I did have a support request, they got back to me in 1-2 days with real answers that took some effort even though I wasn't paying any extra for a support contract. So while you can get a VPS from a cut-rate provider with theoretically twice the resources for the same price, you're going to have to pre-pay for 1+ months and won't be able to resize the VPS without going through a shopping cart and pre-paying again where as DO will let you scale up and down at will and just bill by the minute. So overall, DO is reliable, less complicated than the mega-services, and still has reasonable treatment of the little guy. There's not much to complain about.

name: Hex Tech
review_body: Honestly I have yet to try other service providers besides DigitalOcean, since I clearly hit the perfect mark from the start. Have been with them since 2017, hosting a variety of web apps. Overall they are amazing due to: - Really Affordable Pricing - Great Help Documentation - Superb customer support, open a ticket and within a day usually I was helped and they are always friendly - Never had a single hour of down time - Their services are easily scalable - They have great variety of services from storage mounts to Object Storage Spaces - The dashboard is super easy to use All in all, there hasn't been a single red flag for me and will most likely continue to use them as long as I can.

name: Julian
review_header: The best host with the worst support.
review_body: The best host with the worst support. You could do so much better. Dealing with Digital Ocean's support team is like trying to balance a house of cards in a hurricaine... with a blindfold on and both arms tied behind your back. I explained a very simple situation to them and they came back offering their profound wisdom on a completely different situation. I then clarified my situation and they come back saying they can't help because they don't have access to user accounts. What is the point of having a support team that cannot offer any support? I actually got a solution from ChatGPT.... from a robot... they are wasting money on their support staff.

name: Thad Guidry
review_body: Really decent customer support if you pay $99 a month and well worth it when needed to resolve issues. Especially when you get yourself into a corner because you didn't read closely their excellent docs!

name: Tom
review_header: Service Terminated At Random With Zero Explanation
review_body: Pretty appalled by the treatment I have received from this provider. I created an account with DigitalOcean in May of 2014. I used the account to spin up a single droplet at that time and kept it running for around a year. I believe at the time I was using it to host a Wordpress blog which I was developing a theme for. The day before yesterday (nearly 8 years since the droplet was active) I attempted to login to the account and was met with a notice that my account was locked/disabled and that I needed to contact support. I couldn't remember my history with this provider at the time I signed in as a long time had past and I have hosting with close to 8 different hosting providers, some I've been using for 20 years! So I opened a ticket and asked what was going on, I couldn't remember when I last used this account but would like it unlocked so I could check my account history and change my password as it'd been unchanged for many years. The response I got was pretty shocking: "Upon reviewing your account, it appears that your deployment and actions were in violation of our Terms of Service Agreement [1] and Acceptable Use Policy [2] and as a result, your account has been locked and offboarded from our platform." They proceeded to inform me that they can't tell me what it is that I have done and not to attempt to sign up again with a new account as I am banned permanently from their service. This response forced me to go and dig through email backups to see when I signed up, when I last used it and if I had any correspondence from them at all regarding this. I had absolutely no messages from them regarding "violating" anything nor any messages about the service being suspended. I have never been treated this way by a hosting provider before - I absolutely never violated their Terms of Service nor have I violated any providers T&S. They have clearly made a huge mistake. It's worrying I think for other users - I didn't have an active service with them so no loss but If they can callously terminate your account for nothing without any warning, I dread to think how this could impact users who have active droplets or busy websites. Disgusting.

Needless to say I really appreciate Jonathan Swayne's insight into the issue I was having. The services I use through them from hosting servers to run custom net applications, to gaming services the development costs are very reasonable, and the payment method and options are fantastic to get a realistic expectation on how a full deployment may cost.

Microsoft hold millions of IP's and manage to prevent spam bots running wild on their systems so please do the same. We are a Happy Customer until proven otherwise :)

They did when I never subscribed, and I didn't even know about the existence of this company. As a result, I had to cancel my debit card and present a formal complaint to my bank to avoid future scams and money refunds. Don't trust DigitalOcean, they are a scam. Now I realized that I am not the only one who experienced this with them.

name: Stephen Irvine
review_body: Sadly another situation of "Computer says no" approach to their business. Have a business account with Digital Ocean that an ex employee set up under a company email address. The billing lapsed and have tried to login to update the billing details but cannot access the account as it's pulling an a login error. I've spent nearly 2-3 weeks going back and forth with their team trying to get access to the account to no avail. There circular logic for access is painful and as a result their final communication is there is nothing we can do. No additional response, no apology, no guidance on setting up a new one and transferring the files. So all in a service that works unless you need an actual human to do any thinking!! Have found an alternate service and am transferring my app files to this with immediate affect and an account that is left unpaid because there is no way for me to pay the balance and update my credit card details. Seems almost unreal to even write that!!

name: Emmanuel Gontcho
review_header: DigitalOcean: A Reliable and Affordable Cloud Platform
review_body: I have been using DigitalOcean for several years now, and I have been very impressed with their service. They offer a reliable, affordable, and easy-to-use cloud platform that has helped my business grow. One of the things that I appreciate most about DigitalOcean is their customer service. I have had to contact them on a few occasions, and they have always been helpful and responsive. They are also very knowledgeable about their products, which makes it easy to get the help that I need. Another thing that I appreciate about DigitalOcean is their infrastructure. It is efficient, secure, and fast. This is essential for my business, as I need to be able to rely on my cloud platform to be up and running at all times. The user experience on DigitalOcean is also great. The dashboard is easy to use, and the documentation is comprehensive. This has made it easy for me to get started with DigitalOcean and to troubleshoot any issues that I have encountered. Overall, I am very happy with DigitalOcean. They have provided me with a reliable, secure, and affordable cloud platform that has helped my business grow. I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a cloud platform. Pros: Reliable Affordable Easy to use Comprehensive documentation Excellent customer service Cons: None that I have found Overall: I highly recommend DigitalOcean to anyone looking for a reliable, affordable, and easy-to-use cloud platform.

review_body: DigitalOcean is an extremely responsible host, demonstrating an unwavering commitment to enforcing zero abuse tolerance, which sets them apart from other hosts that often neglect the presence of malicious users on their platforms. We are grateful to DigitalOcean for their dedication to creating a safer and more transparent online environment. We wholeheartedly intend to consider their services for our future projects.

review_body: Digital ocean support experts helped me to solve my issue by explaining what should i do in my droplet step by step. Thanks for their patience and kindness.

name: Catt
review_body: Amazing documentation and great support team - on top of an amazing technical product. So much flexibility and functionality, lots of UI decisions designed to make it easy for develoeprs. 100% recommend Digital Ocean. I used it 8 years ago for a website and just used it again now it's stayed true to how good it was back then as well as getting more powerful and more affordable. Keep developing the amazing product DO!

name: Michael Leonetti
review_header: They will lock out your account arbitrarily with no reason given or recourse
review_body: They are super easy to get up servers and get stuff loaded quickly. I was a customer there for at least 10 years. However, one day they locked my account. When I asked support why and to please unlock it they said that I had violated their Terms of Service and Acceptable Usage policies. Then they said "please note that weâ€™re unable to share details regarding what factors we considered that led to this decision." They concluded their e-mail with "We recommend you find a new service provider that better suits your needs." If you're wondering whether or not I did illegal and terrible things that might violate these agreements, the answer is "no." I ran my business servers on their servers for about 10 years. In short, their service is great. However, just do yourself a favor and make REGULAR backups OFF of DigitalOcean. One day they may just shut you down for a reason they can't disclose. Or you can choose to not go with them at all and avoid the headache.

The support provided in the chat conversation does not demonstrate a high level of expertise, personalised assistance, or accurate information. It seems this type of response is geared up to push premium support, which is understandable for technical or time-consuming problems. But the simple set-up is a bit meh

name: shakeel viam
review_header: I recently had the pleasure ofâ€¦
review_body: I recently had the pleasure of experiencing DigitalOcean's exceptional customer support, and I couldn't be more impressed. From their prompt and precise responses to their empathetic approach in resolving issues, DigitalOcean has truly set a new standard for customer service. One of the most remarkable aspects of my experience with DigitalOcean was the speed at which they addressed my concerns. Each time I reached out for assistance, their support team responded swiftly, ensuring that I didn't have to wait long to receive the help I needed. This level of responsiveness was crucial for me as a customer, as it minimized any downtime and allowed me to continue with my projects seamlessly. However, what truly sets DigitalOcean apart is the genuine empathy they demonstrated throughout our interactions. Their support agents took the time to understand the nuances of my issues, showing a high level of attentiveness and care. They didn't just provide generic solutions but tailored their responses to meet my specific needs. This personalized approach made me feel valued and reassured that my concerns were being given the attention they deserved. Moreover, the solutions provided by DigitalOcean's support team were precise and effective. They clearly understood the technical aspects of my challenges and were able to guide me through the troubleshooting process with ease. Their expertise and knowledge were evident in the accurate and practical solutions they offered, ensuring that I could resolve my issues swiftly and get back to my work without any hindrance. Overall, my experience with DigitalOcean has been outstanding. Their customer support team has been nothing short of exceptional, exhibiting a level of professionalism and dedication that is hard to find elsewhere. I highly recommend DigitalOcean to anyone in need of reliable and efficient cloud hosting services, backed by a team that genuinely cares about its customers. DigitalOcean has truly set a benchmark in terms of support and service, and it's no wonder they are widely recognized as a leader in the industry. I am grateful for their assistance and will continue to rely on their services with confidence. Disclaimer: This review is based on my personal experience and opinion. Your experience with DigitalOcean may vary.

review_body: 100% excellent in reliability and support. Digitalocean still the best among the competitors.

review_body: After updating my Ubuntu droplet I couldn't get ssh access. Using the recovery console nothing was obviously wrong so contacted DO support. Their response was quick, professional and courteous. They recommended a process to help debug my issue, and I was able to resolve it and gain access. Great support from them.

review_body: I've been using digital Ocean for 5 years now for my business , they were by my side, my ups and down, my experience with them were pleasant.

review_header: worst company to host a server
review_body: I was expecting a response from support for 2 months. After 2 months, I was informed that in no way would they unblock port 25 for receiving mail. The company has gone horribly wrong. Treat customers like garbage.

name: Bronius Motekaitis
review_header: Even the seasoned tech needs a more knowledgable friend in the Cloud
review_body: I am pretty technical and quite proficient with many things, but I found myself in a pickle. Though I am a two-bit nobody as far as a customer generating revenue, DO support was quick and willing to help. And of course they had the right answers right away.

name: Wes
review_header: Digital Ocean support is fast and effective
review_body: When I received an email describing a rather annoying situation (I owed less than $1, but invoices can only be paid if amount is greater than $1), I reached out to Digital Ocean support, who was fast and effective in resolving the "issue".

name: David P.
review_header: Negative experience in account setup. However appears to be flexible and good value.
review_body: Setting up a VPS with a UK presence. The company seems to have an issue that a UK business can have a foreign living director. Everything was completed, but a canned response was sent and asked for social media details. Which weren't needed. Not an instant setup, it took around 24 hours to get launched, after responding to their email explaining that my UK business is registered with a banking payment card from a Spanish address and correctly reflected in HMRC, companies house etc.. What I did not wish to undertake was social media verification and as said, a canned response it wasn't needed. But now the account has been activated, the services look good value. The support response following the canned response, was much better, I believe the boarding elements could be handled differently the personal response which followed was reassuring, so I edited this review appropriately. Knocking one star off for the delay.

name: David Svarrer
review_header: Digital Ocean - an ocean of no Digital Response
review_body: Well, I have for the longest time tried to sign up with this company. The only thing I have really got return from them, is spam, spam and more spam. They are advertising alllll their fantastic supports and services, but, when one wants to sign up - you get none of it. Well. They ask you to deposit USD 5 to signup, and while it is a bit peculiar, I thought - OK - it will for sure filter out all those who are not serious. But. The ones who should be paying USD 5, is actually Digital Ocean. I had several questions to them, and have in various ways written to them to ask, but, no response. After giving them a piece of my mind, suddenly they responded, but, sent it all back to me, as if they had not read what my request was about - and I am still at square 1 with them. The point I cannot get them to explain is, what it would cost to run with them. Their response is to try them out. Well. As a professional cloud provider should they not have more than 10 years of experience to figure out how in measurable terms to tell a prospect client what to expect? The point of the matter is, that if a corporation cannot even have human beings to respond to queries from a beginner user - then how would we ever grow with them? The date below is the most recent experience with them. I have had more than 20 encounters with them, as they have kept advertising how good they are. Sorry to say so, but, it has been one big disappointment. Sigh.

review_body: Every time I created a new droplet, I couldn't connect to it after a day or so. I had to create a new one and do all the preps again. I worked with the support team to resolve it. It took them more than a week to realise their security team blocked the access every time. The next day after they lifted the restrictions my account got blocked and I was asked for photographs of my id along with my face. After reading all the reviews I'll probably move to AWS as the others suggest to have a move pleasant experience.

Needless to say we were able to fix it in under an hour with the information provided and recovery tools available in the console by Digital Ocean support.

review_header: I am absolutely thrilled to give aâ€¦
review_body: I am absolutely thrilled to give a glowing review of the support team at DigitalOcean.com! The dedication and friendliness they exhibit is absolutely remarkable. They truly go above and beyond to ensure their customers have a seamless hosting experience. One thing that really sets DigitalOcean's support team apart is their commitment to being available 24/7. No matter what time of day it is, you can always count on them to be there to answer your questions and help you troubleshoot any issues you may be experiencing. They are incredibly responsive and efficient in their communication, which can make all the difference when you're dealing with technical problems. In addition to their accessibility, the support team at DigitalOcean is incredibly knowledgeable and skilled in their craft. They have a deep understanding of the products and services they offer, and they are always eager to share their expertise with their customers. They are patient and kind when helping customers navigate complex technical issues, making the process as stress-free as possible. Finally, I must mention the exceptional level of friendliness that DigitalOcean's support team embodies. They truly care about their customers and take the time to build strong relationships with them. They understand that hosting can be a confusing and overwhelming process, and they work hard to make sure their customers feel comfortable and supported every step of the way. Overall, I cannot recommend the support team at DigitalOcean.com enough. Their commitment to excellence, expertise, and friendly service is truly outstanding. If you're looking for a hosting provider with a top-notch support team, look no further than DigitalOcean!

name: Arun S.
review_body: Unreliable cloud service provider I have use this service long time ago And spent more than 10k dollar with them I use snap shot for keep my instance for a while, They suck my money for backup snapshot Which after few months can not use and can not recovery back, Which that snapshot I lost software licensed more than 3k dollars for nothing. So this give me another reason to not trust sketchy cloud service provider that do not have real customer service unit.

Their support is top notch and they continue to be innovative and disruptive with their product offerings. Thank you guys!

Using app platform makes it very easy and fast to get things up and running. Their pricing is very good and they offer way more bang for your buck compared to a platform like Heroku

review_body: Customer service was always willing to help, in fact they pointed me directly to the cause of my issue and even helped me all the way till I could narrow down my error and fix. Iâ€™m really impressed.
