review_body: I'm used DigitalOcean for my blogs from past 3 years, it's working great, but recently server is down, but i don't have any traffic to my blogs, everything is alright for me. I am trying to upgrade my droplet, Thank you Team DigitalOcean!!!

name: Virginia Murray
review_body: I experienced the same thing as Chris below. I tried creating an account for the first time, deposited $20 and the account was locked for no reason. That's pretty preposterous. How else am I supposed to use your service without funds? I got the refund though, so that's a good sign, I guess.

name: Chris Sun
review_body: About 1 hour ago, I was registering on DO's website for the first time. The registration process required me to pay for the first month usage. I paid the amount via PayPal and the system redirected me to an Account Locked page right away. I immidiately contacted their support. And all I got was a boilerplate reply: "Your account was found to match patterns associated with fraudulent behavior, which is a violation of our Terms of Service. After review, we have determined that restoring access to your account is not possible. " Lucky I got the refund. I guess this is the beging and the end between me and DO.

name: Robert Harris
review_header: They kept charging us for a site we noâ€¦
review_body: They kept charging us for a site we no longer hosted with them. With no phone customer support and virtually no other support it was very convenient for them not to respond to our complaints. Disputing their fees through AMEX was my only remedy before leaving. We absolutely would not recommend them. It's not the deal you think it is.

name: Houssam Chergui
review_body: Non existent DDos whatsoever. I received DDos attacks on a droplet, all i was getting is an automatic email that informs me that my website & apps are all offline due to their "BLACKHOLE". It is 2020 and DigitalOcean doesn't spend a penny on decent minor DDos protection when i got a tiny 2GBp/s attack! If you have any serious website running i advise you to avoid them at all cost especially if you have bad competitors that can DDos you.

name: Angie
review_header: I received a fake email from Google
review_body: I received a fake email from Google. When I looked up the IP address, it was from DigitalOcean.com. Maybe soneone used their services to send an email that demanded a reply(which when clicked on, would most assuredly delivered some type of malware) however, the trail les to that company

name: Blair Urquhart
review_body: I have asked group for over 6 months to stop trying to bill me for a service I am not using and I have tried many times to cancel their service which they keep stopping me from doing which is why to me they are a group of Fraudsters

name: JL Hagger
review_header: We've used them for about 2 years now
review_body: We've used them for about 2 years now - everything positive so far.

name: Leonidas Papoulakis
review_body: Great products and solutions, that aim for the professionals!

name: Julie
review_header: Not a professional company, you'll be better off with Squarespace.
review_body: My credit card expired and I wasn't able to update it due to personal reasons (not because of lack of funds - I just didn't monitor the email address where the automated emails were being sent) I owed them $11 which I paid for in full only to find out they had completely deleted my website. They had my phone number, they could have texted me or given me a call to confirm before deleting my work. 6 years of content down the drain. I'm not super tech-savvy, I guess that's on me. Now no one is replying to my emails. WHO THE HELL DO THESE PEOPLE THINK THEY ARE.

name: James
review_header: No major issues with servers, pretty solid support
review_body: We are running on Digital Ocean for more than 2 years, we use a lot of droplets, spending $1k+ month. If we used something like AWS our bill would be probably $10k+. No major issues with servers, pretty solid support.

name: Suraj Lyons
review_header: I was surprised to see the poor score
review_body: I was surprised to see the poor score. I've used DO for upwards of 4 years, I've always had good experiences w/ their support team. They offer very fast servers (using speedtest-cli, I've consistently had faster network speeds than other vendors, aws, azure, etc).

name: Artur S.
review_header: Support doesn't really want to help
review_body: Support doesn't really want to help, they just don't care. It's like talking to a wall. If one day the billing system denies the card, you doomed. There's no way to resolve that. Just try to find any phone number.

name: Nayyar Abdul Shaikh
review_body: Very Bad Services & support. They claim "24/7/365 world-class support", but it's the worst support I could imagine. I could not connect to my newly created droplets in Bangalore. Created a ticket with all the details described. Got an answer in 2 hours basically saying that they know that I can connect, just the SSH session is slow. Which is absolutely wrong. I answered and got no reply. After 2 days of silence I decided I don't want to use this service.

name: Johnny
review_body: The VPS's themselves are fine, nothing Vultr doesn't do better. However their billing and support is where they fall flat. I currently have a due balance and I am intending on paying it, however when you have a balance due you cannot destroy droplets. So currently I am being charged for a service that I don't even want to use. I contacted their support and they refuse to delete my droplets because I have a balance due. I'll be avoiding these guys in the future.

name: Stevie J Jones
review_body: I have to agree that itâ€™s about understanding the offer. If you are a developer confident in self-managing your cloud servers via the command line, itâ€™s fantastic. There are also lots of how-to docs around. Hard to score Digital Ocean because for me, most days itâ€™s 5. However... Where things really fail is support. Forget it. If anything goes wrong, youâ€™re on your own. I got locked out of my account after getting a new phone and when the backup codes I had stored didnâ€™t work, I had to submit a ticket. No reply. Other hosting companies have far better support so if thatâ€™s important to you, avoid DO. They assure me they are aware of the issues around support, but given the number of reviews that mention the lack of it, Iâ€™m not sure theyâ€™re nailing it. I will continue to use them with no hesitation as Iâ€™ve only had to submit 2 support incidents in 2 years - very reliable and I love the platform otherwise.

name: Alex Borkin
review_body: Really disgusting company. We found that they were hosting stolen content of ours for another client. Tons of emails and attempts to have it taken down were met with silence. Be careful

name: Kris
review_body: Wanted to split a machine and gave DO a try. 3 days after I moved a piece I got a email 'Emergency Droplet Migration' and my filesystem went corrupt. My previous provider had 1 issue in 5 years here I had a fatal one after 3 days. Stay away for production stuff!

name: Anton Manyanin
review_body: They claim "24/7/365 world-class support", but it's the worst support I could imagine. I could not connect to my newly created droplets in Europe. Created a ticket with all the details described. Got an answer in 2 hours basically saying that they know that I can connect, just the SSH session is slow. Which is absolutely wrong. I answered and got no reply. After 24 hours of silence I decided I don't want to use this service.

name: Zack Tron
review_header: Stay away - Anyone looking for serious hostingâ€¦
review_body: Anyone looking for serious hosting service should stay away. Support does not exist and server/service is not reliable.

name: Sebastian H.
review_header: The worst hosting company in the world
review_body: The worst hosting company in the world. Absolutely no support. No phone number. No email address. It takes them 48 hours at the least to reply to a ticket. They disconnected our droplet while it was on a LIVE application. They gave us ZERO warning and did not take responsibility for it. They never gave us any compensation for it. I lost over $10,000 in developer fees, lost opportunity, server costs as well as the stress factor of having an app that was down for a month. I am considering taking legal action against DigitalOcean and I suggest everyone to STAY AWAY from such a horrible, despicable, and irredeemable company like them. They have no sense for business, customer service or common decency. It will be a great day in the internet world when they cease to exist as a company and the reputation of such business practices follows the leadership team everywhere they go.

name: Michael D
review_header: Great if you understand the proposition
review_body: I feel like the negative reviews on here misunderstand the nature of DigitalOcean. It is not (and do not market themselves as) a managed hosting service with a great support system. It's true, the support is almost non-existent. I've used DigitalOcean for six years, and the only time I created a ticket, response times were very slow. But if you need lots of virtual servers of varying power and you are confident to manage them yourself, DigitalOcean is brilliant. It's cheap as chips and the user interface is elegant and simple. Deploy servers in under 1 minute! If you can remember web hosting in even the 2000s, this never gets old. Bottom line: if you're confident that you have the skills to manage your own servers, run your own disaster recovery setup, and want lots of power while keeping costs low, DigitalOcean is pretty much the gold standard.

name: ÐÐ»ÐµÐºÑÐµÐ¹
review_body: Using DO for my dev-projects. Fast deployment, low cost, user friendly interface, tons of manuals. I wouldnâ€™t recommend DO for high-performance/ high-load web-projects.

No further information or action is required from you." (Money gone) I swear, i created a support ticket on : 24 May and guess what, they replied me on 30 May. 6 days, there was no one there working. Note : Avoid the false review about DigitalOcean.com (Posting in the other blogs), They lie, they are using us to gain money from our back.

Nothing would be required to discontinue the account going forward and no additional responses from you are required. So indirectly saying, do not use our services..

review_body: Solid Price, perfect uptime, solid service, fast speeds, fast admin panel, and easily scalable.

name: Mike
review_body: I signed up for a new account which was subsequently locked upon creation. It took customer service several weeks to respond (during which time I had a business requirement to fulfill) and ultimtately they replied thus: "We have reviewed your account and have declined to activate it. No further information or action is required from you." No reason offered; complete indifference. I wholeheartedly recommend everyone to avoid this provider.

review_body: I was baited with a $50 offer, inserted credit card info, they wanted to collect very personal data. We all know at this age of the internet we should never trust/trade our full personal information in exchange of services. They will just drop a woopsie "hack" alert someday to benefit from personal data sales. Got proof of every conversation if anybody is interested, I got my account locked as soon as I accused them of possible identity thieves.

Because Digital Ocean do nothing about it, I asked them to blacklist my email across their entire server farm as I do not want any more spam from their users. I am now going through the process of blocking Digital Ocean's entire IP range in an attempt to block this abuse. Do business with a company like this? No thanks, and I would recommend others avoid them too.

review_body: Great service & uptime. Control panel looks very professional. Had a VPS from them for a couple of months, as a part of free credits from GitHub Student Developer Pack. Can't really complain of anything.

name: Stephen â€œJack Jackâ€ Henry
review_body: I signed up for Digital Ocean droplet and my account was locked out straight away. I put in a ticket which took four weeks to get a reply for simply to say they were unable to verify my account and asked me to go to another service provider... They gave no options for me to get myself verified nor gave me a refund on the funds I already moved across. I've replied but I do not expect a reply for another month. Really bad customer service, I am unable to comment on the service itself.

name: Per-Arne Dahl Kristiansen
review_body: Awesome VPS Give you a good VPS with a good tb bandwith. Can be a little expensive. but else works!

name: Sam
review_body: Categorically the worst support I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with. Tickets are ignored, or (more worryingly) lost. Makes you wonder where your other data is going. Avoid.

name: Anthony Cosgrove
review_header: Unfair Business Practices - Forgot to Cancel Trial and was Billed $40
review_body: I forgot about my account and never received notice of the expiring credit. Had I have gotten that notice I would have closed my account on the spot as I was never intending to continue service. A whole month went by and I got an invoice where I immediately presented my case to their support crew. They pretty much told me to pound sand claiming the ToS clearly states blah blah blah. Well considering the ToS amounts to browser wrap agreement B.S. I have filed complaints with the BBB and the FTC and will be disputing with my bank next. It's disappointing when businesses rely on the users that have forgotten to cancel services in order to collect monthly revenue. Hopefully my complaints will put greater emphasis on consumer protection and stop these practices. DO I give you guys an F-

name: Natasha Gan
review_body: I had a short-lived, underwhelming experience with DigitalOcean. To finish signing up, I tried FOUR different credit cards from THREE different banks and TWO different countries, all of which were declined for no reason. I contacted support and was told that they do not take international credit cards to which I replied "what constitutes as international? is it non-US or non-North American or...?". I was then told by another specialist that it's actually my banks that aren't accepting DO transactions, which I think is a poor attempt save themselves from a silly first answer. I've travelled everywhere with these 4 cards and of course these credit cards can support international charges. I've called my banks (a waste of time) and everything looks ok. My business can't wait for this much back and forth so I will be going to a different provider.

name: David Vence
review_header: Digital Ocean's customer service is nonâ€¦
review_body: Digital Ocean's customer service is non existent. They lock accounts for no good reason and just don't answer to tickets raised. Switch to Amazon or others. This is purely unacceptable. I lost significant amounts of data because of them.

name: Terry Loerch
review_body: Save your money and time. They will lock your account and still try to take payment when you can not access any of your data. I have been trying to deal with my locked account because they are saying they didnt get payment.... I had to screenshot their billing to show them they got paid....Can you believe it.. I had to pull data from their site to show that I paid the account.... But the account is still locked to get a nasty remark from a girl in India... Im at the point of finding a lawyer because they are still billing me and will not give me access to what i am paying for holding my data for hostage.. Not even the fact I have asked them 10 times why my bill is very high, to no answers back..

name: Alexander Mirvis
review_header: Currently working with a Law Firm onâ€¦
review_body: Currently working with a Law Firm on Legal action against them and their company is nothing but low standard service. Majority of their clients are hackers and spammers, who take advantage of their infrastructure. In fact, when I made numerous complaints to terminate the user who was Phishing for Social Security numbers and spamming, they sent me a response saying that they will not take any action. I called their corporate office and they specifically told me that they will not take any action against paying clients. Majority of their IP's for their VPS's are also black listed for spam.

Luckily I paid using PayPal hence DO was unable to store my card details. No explanation, no apologies. Browsing another reviews I see that it is the standard quality of service with this company. The advice someone gives here to go for Lightsail is legitimate. There is one thing I am impressed: they managed to score close to 50% bad (one star) reviews. Good Job! ;-)

review_body: Terrible services. They lost all data from two websites of mine. As I asked them what happened they told me their "engineers" were trying to solve but couldn't rescue any data. Don't go with them if you are searching for a secure place to host your website.

name: pooler
review_header: using their VPS for more than 4 yearsâ€¦
review_body: using their VPS for more than 4 years without problem ! great payment system, invoices, support, services maybe not cheapest, but they have the most and best services

name: Cady
review_header: Great services but appalling customer service
review_body: I've been with Digital Ocean for over 3 years and for the first time recently required tech support due to troubles with their emailing of authentication codes. Their tech support are slower than they are arrogant. It took 5 days to get nowhere with them - while they publicly acknowledged an error with their emailing, privately they blamed me & were unhelpful then just gave up. Great services but the negative reviews are accurate - their customer service is appalling. If this matters to you, go elsewhere.

name: Tom Greinert
review_header: mixed feelings the so called best inâ€¦
review_body: mixed feelings the so called best in ... not always the best its simply a hosting company how paste a plenty money in but when i make some speed tests there are better once. not realy that top 10 but everybody should try them self nothign realy lost bec the cost is per hour and so 20 bugs in that business is low..

name: Eric
review_header: Signed up for droplet from home addressâ€¦
review_body: Signed up for droplet from home address and used home billing credit card and they locked my account and then refused to provide any reason as to why they were banning me LOL. They of course took my billing card details and now refuse to remove my credit card even though my account is locked out forever. This is a violation of GDPR and other US regulations. I've never even used DO before and we deploy over 500 servers via linode, softlayer, rackspace, amazon EC2 etc... and have never ever had such a rude and unacceptable experience. I will make it a point to let all my business partners here in Palo Alto know never ever to use Digital Ocean after the treatment we received.

name: Sam Yuen
review_header: Debited money from my account withoutâ€¦
review_body: Debited money from my account without me knowing and authorisation. Customer service cannot tell me what the payment is for, so they closed my case. This is a scam!

name: Kurt Obando
review_body: Great documentation, and price list are flexible. The only challenge that I had with them was the restoration tools, for example, if you wish to restore a snapshot also known as image. It may take hours and got stuck in the middle bar, without any progress out. Anyhow, experience was Great.

name: Charlie Hook
review_header: Locked out of account due to DigitalOcean bugs, ignored by support
review_body: DigitalOcean's implementation of Google SSO is broken, and it is preventing me from logging into my account. We changed our GSuite primary domain and switched to a new e-mail address. This shouldn't affect SSO (and it hasn't on any of our other services), but I receive "User not found" when I try to log into my DigitalOcean account, completely preventing us from accessing our account in any fashion. We continue to be billed but can't do anything about it. I contacted support over a week ago, and they asked for a copy of my government-issued identification and a photo of myself, along with credit card details, which is pretty extraordinary, but I sent it all within a day, and then received no response. Then they closed my support ticket without doing anything, even though I'm still being billed. UPDATE: A manager from DigitalOcean reached out after seeing this review (see below) and had my issue resolved by the next morning.

name: Jonathan Jolly
review_body: Hmmm... Let's say I'm a malicious attacker and I want to damage your company and destroy hours of work... Oh I know!! You run Digial Ocean service - this is so easy!! Once I've deleted your account you're done!!! Hi There, We've finished reviewing your account and cannot allow you access to the DigitalOcean platform. This decision is final and no other information is required. Regards, Trust & Safety DigitalOcean Support Moral of the story = just setup a lightsail!!

name: Peter D
review_header: Another provider I've been using for aâ€¦
review_body: Another provider I've been using for a couple years. Never had any issues and service have been rock solid. Would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably prices and reliable service.

name: johnc
review_header: Rubbish customer support. No contact number.
review_body: Pros: cheap if you don't include downtime in your costs. Cons: Awful customer service. Flaky login in system requiring entry of codes that are emailed to you. The delivery of these is unreliable. No phone number to call support

name: Michael
review_header: Quite literally the worst out there
review_body: Quite literally the worst out there. Unreliable servers and/or connection. It does not matter if you are a large organisation or a one man team, the service they are providing is simply trash.

name: Amir
review_header: i worked and have experience withâ€¦
review_body: i worked and have experience with Azure, AWS and Google cloud. and i can say that hands down, digital ocean is one of the best services out there. the costs are significantly lower. although they could maybe add additional regions to their services

name: Stewart
review_body: They deleted all my stuff My card had expired and I hadn't realised, the chaser emails had gone into the "Updates" tab in gmail. 2 unpaid bills after years of custom, boom, everything gone. Everything I'd written over the last few years. It's a bit severe.

name: Jatin Lal
review_body: Worst service, signed up on Digital Ocean around 5 days back, planned to host some important websites. My account is still blocked. Tried contacting support multiple times, but didn't received a single reply from them. This is the most pathetic support I have ever seen. Just don't host any important website on DigitalOcean, as in case of failure of server or any other issue, your website will remain corrupted for weeks, and your whole business will be spoiled. They don't even care.

name: R Peck
review_body: Used them for years - they had a bad reputation in the beginning (I think they spammed Internet forums) but have since become highly reputed in the market.

name: James Flynn
review_body: What can I say? DO are absolutely great at what they do and what they offer. Support could be more responsive and maybe a tad friendlier, but, hunting down solutions myself always leads back to DO docs, so yes, their real time support may lack in certain places but they provide more than enough manuals to get help which is amazing service in itself. The only downside is there are many other hosts who offer the same or more for much cheaper prices in todays market.

name: Jake Noble
review_body: If you have issues, such as a slow server or downtime they will offer no help. Just a standard reply to some FAQs about slow PHP (in my case). Despite proving that the issue was nothing to do with my code, even one page PHP pages that said "hello world" would go down. They did nothing. Avoid and use someone else.

name: Mal
review_header: Great for small and medium scaledâ€¦
review_body: Great for small and medium scaled projects and very cheap. Fast Support and many locations available.

name: Raghunathan Raghunathan
review_body: Worst Services, i was using digitalocean for past 2 years and last week updated my server and after a week it went down and got an email that my server got compromised and they disabled the network, i dropped an email, created ticket to shutdown all services in the droplet and ask them downloading my data, their support was pathetic and i have raised the concern in their twitter account, FB page and finally after a day they enabled my services, luckily i kept all my backup in different servers, finally i moved all my services from digitalocean to other service providers. worrying if would keep all my data in their datacenter itself i would end up with loss of my 2 years data.

name: Per-Arne D. Kristiansen
review_body: Great company with great droplets, you shall know where to host your droplet before choosing, your stupid if you choose USA when your in Europe. I'm from Norway so England VPS works great or Netherlands, Amsterdam.

name: Sven A
review_body: Tried to host a game on a VPS. While it was easy to set up, it had horrible pings... in game but not outside. support couldn't tell me why... just told me to upgrade. Moved to a GSP

name: Christopher Bennett
review_header: Horrible service, don't care about their clients AT ALL!!!!
review_body: Ok, so Iâ€™ve been using DigitalOcean since 2013 and everything was just fine. An on May 31 2018 something really worrying happened, all my files got deleted and I received this email: â€œWe sincerely apologize, however, there was an incident impacting the Spaces service that resulted in a number of Spaces and the data within them to be deleted. At this time we're performing a full internal investigation to determine what the cause of the issue was as well as why it happened. Once we have a full understanding and additional details to share, we'll follow up. At this time, unfortunately, we can confirm that the data within your Spaces has been lost and is not recoverable. We deeply apologize for any inconvenience this has caused.â€ They never informed me further and none of my files were restore. No compensation except for $400 on my account, saying: â€œYou have been granted credit to use on your DigitalOcean team for $400.00. Weâ€™ve updated your balance, which you can view at your team's billing page. Please note that this credit will expire after 12 months if it's not used.â€ I took severe losesâ€¦ Now I am in the process of transferring to another service. Well, decide for yourself whether use their services, but I am really devastated by both my losses and their absolute ignorance.

name: Chris K
review_header: Signed up 5 days ago and my droplet isâ€¦
review_body: Signed up 5 days ago and my droplet is still inactive. No reaction to email, support ticket or social media message. That was my first and last try to go with DigitalOcean. Can clearly not recommend a company with such a horrible customer support.

name: Tien Dung Dao
review_body: Bad support, not friendly

name: Ucow Io
review_header: Pay at least 5 dollars to give away all your personal information...
review_body: I guess they are looking for valid CCs they can steal and keep charging. ---------------- No tickets, no contacts. ---------------- Hi There, We've finished reviewing your account and cannot allow you access to the DigitalOcean platform. This decision is final and no other information is required. Regards, Trust & Safety DigitalOcean Support

name: Lonrika Ballard
review_header: Digital Ocean is A Big Credit Card Scammer
review_body: Please, do stay away as far as you can from Digital Ocean and all their promotional links, don't ever click on it and open an account. It is obviously just a super big lie, giving you no bonus at all. Do not trust their promotional event, whatsoever. Do not give them your CC number for verification because they will only charge you with $1 while the bonus they promised will never be arrived into your account even though they'd tell you that they've done so from their notification pop up window, but there will be zero $ still on your billing balance, no at all. And no support ticket answered. That's what they've done to me. I close my account and lose money for nothing on Digital Ocean Scammed Promotion.

name: Islam
review_body: Tell me how should i contact my customers without email? Support did't give any chance to use outgoing smtp relays, even G-Suite accounts. They simply blocks any outgoing requests to popular smtp relays. Must wait 60 days before they review again your status. How can you do business without email these days? The only option they gave me is to deactivate my account and leave them.

name: Gaurav Gupta
review_body: Pathetic experience with Digitalocean. Poorest and arrogant support every faced. With a dedicated 32gb ram server also they keep on using the resources for their other droplets. and not only once but thrice it has happened. and this is their reply. "Thanks for reaching out, and sorry for the trouble there! I found some Droplets that might be using more than their fair share of resources, so I've taken action to mitigate the impact of that on other customers, and I'll follow up with our Trust & Safety team for some additional review. If you do run into any more problems, or there's anything else that we can help with, feel free to let us know. Regards, Platform Support Advocate"

name: NB
review_body: Awful customer service, there are better alternatives out there

name: Utku Demir
review_body: Technical support is terrible!! I'm working with DigitalOcean over the last 3 years. In this period, I needed to have technical support twice only but both of times they let me down so badly!! They may be giving a good service with a good price but this is not making them "good" if they are not there to help you once you needed. It's 3 a.m. here in Turkey and I'm still waiting for an answer to a simple question over the last 8 hours. Huge disappointment!!

name: James
review_header: Been using Digital Ocean for a couple â€¦
review_body: Been using Digital Ocean for a couple of months now - great platform. I love all of the help docs - teach you how to do most things, the ability to create droplets at will and the speed of it.

name: JJ
review_body: Does the job, but admittedly I've never needed to use support

name: Frederik L
review_header: Stay away. Steal your personal information!
review_body: You can not trust this service. Short after a signup I got this email --------- Hi There, We've finished reviewing your account and cannot allow you access to the DigitalOcean platform. This decision is final and no other information is required. Regards, Trust & Safety DigitalOcean Support -------------- Now they have my credit card information, email and personal address. No information about how they will handle my personal information. Just a msg like "bum you'r out" even before I used the service. Stay away from this firm. There are many other alternatives.

name: Ganis Santoso
review_body: I have been using them for 4 years for hosting. During those 4 years, I have minimum needs for support, everything's going well. When I needed support, they responded fast. I have great experience with them. But I would like to point out that I hope (1) they upgrade their server's performance and (2) they reduce their price. Currently, they are a bit lacking in those two points as compared to Vultr/Linode. However, in return you get more features and better UIX with DO.

name: David Gillam
review_body: Absolutely terrible customer support. Automated responses and no responsibility for the mess they make in upgrading.

name: Chris Sanderson
review_body: The set up was unclear about CC vs Pay Pal, Selecting pay pal I ended up still having to enter a credit card, the system then duplicated the credit card entry, and wouldn't allow me to create a team. I managed to delete one card entry , still couldn't create a team due a "can't copy credit card" error.....system now won't allow me to delete my credit card.... "Sorry something went wrong" ...yea too right it did! over all a very frustrating and irritating experience!

name: Ramesh Singhal
review_body: Excellent. Now They have Datacenter in Mumbai. Good Support and Transparent Pricing.

name: Dave Thomas
review_header: Best VPS provider to quickly spin up â€¦
review_body: Best VPS provider to quickly spin up and tear down servers for an ok price. I generally need longer life servers so their pricing doesn't work for me, but is perfect for when I need a test server for ~7 days

name: Peter Tate
review_header: I acknowledge we don't pay for support â€¦
review_body: I acknowledge we don't pay for support - I can appreciate slow responses - BUT when THEY shut your droplet down because it has been 'compromised' and after a week don't even properly read your one-line messages about problems in recovering the data - IT IS TOO BIG A RISK FOR ANY SERIOUS BUSINESS - they still keep charging you for the droplet too.

name: Shoaib
review_body: Ridiculous support. No phone support at all. We needed urgent assistance with our server and had to raise a ticket which they responded to after 2 working days without a solution. Completely unacceptable! Issue is still ongoing and after and still waiting for a response after over 20 messages. Better to use a chepa hosting service that provides phone support instead!

name: Jack
review_body: Extremely fast servers Easy to use control panel Very cheap rates 1TB of network bandwidth included What's not to like?

name: Luke Forrest
review_body: Support is unacceptably slow, I opened a case asking for the recovery ISO to be added to my droplet only to receive an email back 8 hours later telling me that the issue i was having was due to a network outage in their New York DC, my droplet is in a UK DC and the issue was a config issue resulting in my box being unaccessable... I responded within 5 minutes, fast forward 12 hours later and finally received a response saying that the iso had been added, I resolved the issue and asked them to remove the ISO, been waiting around 6 hours now for a response. Do not go with this company unless you are happy with a one man support team.

name: KellyPeterson
review_body: Had my server for 3 months now, and I've had no issues what so ever. Really pleased!

name: Bhavesh Ramburn
review_body: Affordable and just works. No messing about attached drives, SSH, etc... just works out of the box and the setup is really fast.

name: Alison C.
review_body: Fast, Cheap and realiable. Not the most noob-friendly solution though. Love the up- and down-scaling ability

name: Sean Facer
review_header: Backups don't work, customer support slower than a turtle with no legs
review_body: tried to restore our server from a backup which we pay 20% of our monthly bill for. When restoring they have mounted the machine as readonly so I can not use it. Support is non existent via an email address or a ticket support system. You wait for 5 hours for a response without any useful outcome. All this ends up in your site being down and you losing business. Easy to setup yes, for anything you regard as critical stay clear.

name: Bm
review_body: Great hosting with some downtime i high recommend to use their services but you must see their great tuto on the community Been through all hosting sites, for VPS and servers. Gotta say this is the future of hosting. I like the management interface of all Droplets (Servers). cheri3a.com

name: Sam M
review_body: Overpriced servers which can be tons cheaper if you go with other options. After using this service for a while I gave up due to the terrible service as they do not have a proper subscription with Paypal so they manually request money even though I thought they did and they didn't pre-warn me about it they asked for money for a service I didn't even use. Go with another service if you want a VPS.

name: Mr Lewis Cowles
review_body: So I've mentioned in another review that I don't use that supplier for VPS hosting. This is the company I use for my own VPS hosting. They are fast, feature-filled and friendly without being hard to reason about (like Amazon AWS). Also the cloud is a little like the evil guy from needful things, people give with one hand and take with the other. DigitalOcean has never done this, and through their customer engagement platforms I have learned how to use new skills and made suggestions that are now part of their platform. If you have a business, or want to play with the cloud from a safe-space. Try DigitalOcean, I don't think it's possible to regret as the costs are very low and predictable to get into.

name: Nick Carey
review_body: Been so far reliable and consistently priced.

name: Roger
review_body: Good uptime and quick support. I have not noticed any downtimes as of yet. I wish they provided additional IP's per droplet and expandable disk space.

name: Benjamin Eibye
review_body: I createt a droplet, but never used it and forgot about it, but when i was charged on my credit card, and until now the customer service docent answer my question, abou i can get an refund.

name: tom a
review_body: Digitalocean is very good vps, I have never been disappointed and I hope it will stay that way! Highly recommended.

name: Nick B
review_body: The company emailed me to say they will start charging us VAT. We are a US company not an EU one and shouldn't be charged VAT. I contacted their customer service (ticket 806156) and was told I was wrong, they were right and that's that. They were totally unhelpful and couldn't give a damn about trying to fix the issue or provide a decent level of customer care. I'm now very bored of having to tell them they THEY are mistaken, but I guess it's a case of "computer says no". Therefore because of their poor customer service, I do not recommend DigitalOcean.

name: Erin
review_body: I've been using digitalocean for more than six months now and never had any problem with them. Their service is simply excellent for the money!

name: Leaf
review_body: I've been using DO to host a personal server for about a year now; it's been nothing but awesome the whole time. The dashboard is very easy to use, the hardware is top end, and responsiveness excellent. The resources allotted are generous and fair, at a very competitive price. The DO team is constantly improving the dashboard, available distributions, and pre-installed packages. The community is great too; DO walkthroughs are how I got my server running VPN, Web, Proxy, Mail, and SMB services.

name: Biddy
review_body: Good infrastructure. Reliable servers. Good ticket response times. Clear disclosures & communication during upgrades to their facilities.

name: Jesper Nielsen
review_body: Do is definitely the best Linux VPS provider I've worked with. Their very reasonably priced SSD virtual servers performs very well, support is great, network uptime is perfect, and their API is very easy to work with. Can't give DO anything less than 5 stars.

name: Ciril Kotic
review_body: They provide really nice VPS services, easy to set up and start working on. Their game is a little bit different (no Windows VPS), but they play with open cards and I would really recommend them. I've been using their services for few months now, and it all went smooth so far. And hint: they're very generous with $10 coupons (google it).

name: Henrik StrÃ¸m
review_body: I use DigitalOcean for test, development and non-critical systems (critical systems run on Linode). You get great value at DigitalOcean - hard to beat a $5/month virtual private server.

name: Wojtek Bednarzak
review_body: I am a DigitalOcean customer for over a month now. The VPS runs perfectly. I have no problems and I asked the support team non-business related question and they answered me under an hour. Truly impressive and rarely experienced with today's VPS providers. Already recommended to friends
